meanings.definition: A component or part of a larger assembly.
meanings.sent1: The subassemblies of the toy car include the wheels and the chassis.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic carefully inspected each of the subassemblies before assembling the engine.
meanings.sent3: The subassemblies of the puzzle were scattered all over the table, making it a challenging task to put them together.
meanings.sent4: In the recipe, the subassemblies of flour, sugar, and eggs come together to create a delicious cake.
meanings.sent5: The subassemblies of the spaceship were meticulously designed to ensure a successful launch into space.

meanings.definition: To assemble or put together smaller parts to create a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: The workers will subassemblies the computer components to build a fully functional laptop.
meanings.sent2: She subassemblies the ingredients to bake a mouth-watering pie for dessert.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to subassemblies their LEGO pieces to construct a massive castle in their playroom.
meanings.sent4: He carefully subassemblies the wooden planks to create a sturdy bookshelf for his room.
meanings.sent5: The team will subassemblies the data from various sources to generate a comprehensive report for the meeting.
